suncertify.db.file
Class DbFileHandler

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.file.DbFileHandler

public class DbFileHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Handles low level database file access.

Author:
Szymon Bochniak (bochniak.szymon@gmail.com)

Constructor Detail

DbFileHandler

public DbFileHandler(java.lang.String fileName)
Constructs the database handler using given database file name. Throws IllegalArgumentException if the file does not exist.

Parameters:
fileName -
Method Detail

getMetaData

public MetaData getMetaData()
                     throws java.io.IOException
Gets meta data of database file as specified:

Start of file

  • 4 byte numeric, magic cookie value identifies this as a data file
  • 4 byte numeric, offset to start of record zero
  • 2 byte numeric, number of fields in each record

Schema description section. Repeated for each field in a record:

  • 2 byte numeric, length in bytes of field name
  • n bytes (defined by previous entry), field name
  • 2 byte numeric, field length in bytes
File handler caches the metadata once it has read it.

Returns:
MetaData object holding information about database file structure.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when problem accessing file occurs.

readRecord

public Record readRecord(long num)
Reads the record from the database file.

Parameters:
num - number of row to be read form the database file. First row has number 0.
Returns:
Record of data at position num in the database file.

writeRecord

public long writeRecord(long recordNum,
                        java.lang.String[] data)
Stores given data in the database file at the specified position. Used for adding new records as well as updating existing ones.

Parameters:
recordNum - position at which record it to be written. -1 means that a new record needs to be added.
data - data to be stored.
Returns:
position at which record was stored.

writeRecord

public long writeRecord(java.lang.String[] data)
Stores given data in the database file as a new row. Call to this method is equivalent to writeRecord(-1, data);

Parameters:
data - data to be stored
Returns:
position at which record was stored.

markAsDeleted

public boolean markAsDeleted(long num)
Marks as deleted row in database file at the given position.

Parameters:
num - number of row to be marked as deleted.
Returns:
true if row was marked as deleted. false if the record is already marked as deleted or does not exist.
